thread.title: Brett Rodriguez spurs Queensbury to football victory over Mohonasen
thread.title_full: Brett Rodriguez spurs Queensbury to football victory over Mohonasen - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Brett Rodriguez spurs Queensbury to football victory over Mohonasen
text:
CLASS A
Queensbury 59, Mohonasen 27
Player of the game: Brett Rodriguez scored five touchdowns, four rushing and one on a punt return, to lead the Queensbury attack.
Play of the game: Rodriguez opened the scoring with a 74-yard touchdown run to put the Spartans up 6-0.
Stat of the game: Queensbury finished with 440 rushing yards.
Notable: Queensbury improved to 6-2 with the win. ... Rodriguez had 206 yards and four touchdowns on the ground in the first half for the Spartans. ... Queensbury led 52-14 at halftime.
CLASS B
Glens Falls 54, Lansingburgh 7
Player of the game: Aaron Sampson rushed for three touchdowns and 95 yards on just 12 carries to lead Glens Falls to the easy win over Lansingburgh.
Play of the game: Early in the second quarter, Lansingburgh and Glens Falls were tied at 7 when the Glens Falls defense came up big. Jason Agostino 's punt was blocked and recovered by the Indians' Jacob Keast , who returned the ball for a touchdown.
Notables: Glens Falls quarterback Josh Griffen completed both of his pass attempts for 64 yards and a touchdown and he also had nine carries for 42 yards and two more scores. ... Lansingburgh committed five turnovers in the game. ... Glens Falls rushed the ball for 290 yards. ... Lansingburgh finished with 68 yards rushing and 23 yards passing for the game.
CROSSOVERS
Cambridge 53, Ichabod Crane 0
Player of the game: Despite playing largely in just the first period, Cambridge's Colton Dean ran for 73 yards and two touchdowns, and recovered a fumble to set up a score.
Stat of the game: In the first half, after the game's opening kickoff, the average Cambridge drive started on the Ichabod Crane 27-yard line.
Play of the game: Two plays after intercepting a pass to stop an Ichabod Crane drive, Riley Stefanovich went around end for a 20-yard scoring run as time ran out in the first quarter.
Turning point of the game: On the first play of Cambridge's second possession, sophomore quarterback Brenden Holcomb fired a perfect pass to a streaking Ryan McLenithan for a 45-yard touchdown and a 13-0 lead to break open the game.
Notable: Cambridge scored four touchdowns before the first quarter was half over, and six by the first intermission. ... The winning Indians, now 7-1, removed most of their starters late in the first period... Stefanovich, McLenithan, Matt Reedy, Nate Genevick and Zack Rowland intercepted passes for Cambridge, with Rowland returning his for a touchdown. ... Cambridge outgained Ichabod Crane, 252-25, in the first half, but was held to just two yards in offense in the second half. ... Already short-handed, Ichabod Crane was hampered when quarterback Zach Herbst , who ended up as the team's leading rusher with 29 yards, was injured midway through the first quarter. ... Cambridge will next face Canajoharie in a Section II Class D semifinal Saturday at Schuylerville. ... Class B Ichabod Crane , coming off its first win of the year against Cohoes, drops to 1-7.
Canajoharie 28, Watervliet 22
Player of the game: Ken Sullivan rushed the ball 28 times for 132 yards and one touchdown to lead Canajoharie to the win.
Play of the game: On the first play of the game, Ravion Burt returned the opening kickoff 99 yards for a TD for Watervliet .
Schoburg/BKW 32, Salem 14
Player of the game: Schoburg/BKW's Alston Stock carried the ball 18 times for 152 yards and two touchdowns.
Play of the game: Salem's Dave McFarland 's 60-yard fumble recovery for a touchdown in the second quarter helped the Generals to a 14-14 deadlock at halftime.
Notables: Schoburg/BKW got its first win of the season and improved to 1-6. Salem dropped to 1-6.
